comments.author: aionescu@mozilla.com
comments.creator: aionescu@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Talos has detected a Firefox performance regression from push:

https://hg.mozilla.org/integration/autoland/pushloghtml?changeset=585805287f9d5f2cad07b5ee9600e9540342fd7d

As author of one of the patches included in that push, we need your help to address this regression.

Regressions:

  51%  glterrain windows10-64-shippable-qr opt e10s stylo     1.07 -> 1.61
  31%  tscrollx windows10-64-shippable-qr opt e10s stylo      0.83 -> 1.09
  27%  tscrollx windows10-64-shippable-qr opt e10s stylo      0.83 -> 1.06
  10%  tart windows10-64-shippable-qr opt e10s stylo          2.57 -> 2.83


You can find links to graphs and comparison views for each of the above tests at: https://treeherder.mozilla.org/perf.html#/alerts?id=25645

On the page above you can see an alert for each affected platform as well as a link to a graph showing the history of scores for this test. There is also a link to a treeherder page showing the Talos jobs in a pushlog format.

To learn more about the regressing test(s), please see: https://wiki.mozilla.org/TestEngineering/Performance/Talos

For information on reproducing and debugging the regression, either on try or locally, see: https://wiki.mozilla.org/TestEngineering/Performance/Talos/Running

*** Please let us know your plans within 3 business days, or the offending patch(es) will be backed out! ***

Our wiki page outlines the common responses and expectations: https://wiki.mozilla.org/TestEngineering/Performance/Talos/RegressionBugsHandling

comments.text: Hey Jeff - can you take a look at this regression?
comments.raw_text: Hey Jeff - can you take a look at this regression?
comments.author: jessiebonisteel@gmail.com
comments.creator: jessiebonisteel@gmail.com

comments.text: This was fixed by Bug 1630708. Sorry for the inconvenience.
